revised_title: Comparative Anatomy of Nautilus umbilicatus and Nautilus Pompilius
tldr: This article compares the anatomy of Nautilus umbilicatus and Nautilus pompilius, examining their differences and similarities. The author finds that while there are some differences in body size and shape, the internal structures and organs are quite similar. The discovery of a female N. umbilicatus specimen supports the idea that these two species are distinct, despite their close evolutionary relationship.
